artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman leaning forward with her head tilted sideways to the PL, resting on her hands on top of a woodgrained box, with her kimono open exposing her back, on which she received a treatment with moxa, with four black and pink spots on her back; woman wears green kimono with grey flowers and black trim; underkimono with blue pattern with white dots and grey flowers
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ{Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刻 {Wada koku}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 8 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Hot, Behavior of a Housewife of the Bunsei Era
